title: Gauss law - charge q and shells of radii R and 2R

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A point particle with charge <math alttext="positive q" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></math> is located at the center of two concentric spherical conducting shells of radii <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows the point charge and cross-sections of the two shells. The charges, if any, on the two shells are unknown. Also shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> are <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> dots, with <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> dots in each of the following three regions: between the point charge and the shell of radius <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, between the two shells, and outside the shell of radius <math alttext="2 uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. The graph in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> indicates three values of the electric field <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> at different distances <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the point charge, where the positive direction points radially away from the point charge. (a) On Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, draw arrows to indicate the direction of the electric field (not components), if any, at each of the <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> dots. Represent each electric field direction with an arrow that starts on, and points away from, the appropriate dot and is in the direction of the field. If the field is zero at any of the dots, write “<math alttext="E equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>” next to the dot.
